hints.content:
Mom had $\goldE{19}$ pennies.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/04a36fde7fe12ee2c83c7e0b163190baf06c3d65)

To add on the number line, we jump to the **right**.

Then she found $\maroonD{23}$ pennies in the couch. 

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/983a9f63592c47d650dca84bf9f7977b7e449789)

$\goldE{19} + \maroonD{23}= 42$

Mom found $\blueE{31}$ pennies in the car.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/adb0d67303b56530cd2b54201991c3dbadcbe6ad)

$27+  \blueE{21} = 48$

Then mom found $\purpleD{15}$ pennies under the rug. 

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/26db789d9b3aee899390ca943dae8e3f1cd95b02)

$73+\purpleD{15} = 88$

This number line represents how to find the total pennies mom has now:

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/f0b46dff3dbfdcb7fbcac773562176d85e21131e)

Mom has $88$ pennies.

question.content:
Mom had $19$ pennies.   

Then, Mom found $23$ more pennies in the couch, $31$ more pennies in the car, and $15$ more pennies under the rug.    

**Which number line shows how to find how many total pennies Mom has now?**

[[☃ radio 1]]


**How many pennies does Mom have now?**  

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] pennies
